medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation for a punctate cutaneous telangiectasia on the left pinna.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The punctate cutaneous telangiectasia was assessed at 18 months of age. There was no history of epistaxis or melena, and the physical and neurological examinations were normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Family history of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT). No individual past medical conditions mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of HHT: mother's diagnosis after CNS hemorrhage and embolization of pulmonary AVMs; younger brother had an asymptomatic pial AVM; maternal grandfather had multiple pulmonary embolizations; maternal uncle died from spontaneous intracranial hemorrhage; maternal great-grandfather died at 38 from pneumonia.
